headers.subject: [tosdr:617] [Bad] Amazon uses cookies to identify users in third party websites
headers.x-original-authentication-results: ls.google.com; spf=pass (google.com: domain of seppo0010@gmail.com designates internal as permitted sender) smtp.mail=seppo0010@gmail.com; dkim=pass header.i=@gmail.com

html:
http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=footer_privacy?ie=UTF8&nodeId=468496 
Cookies are unique identifiers that we transfer to your device to enable our systems to recognize your device and to provide features such as 1-Click purchasing, Recommended for You, personalized advertisements on other Web sites (e.g., Amazon Associates with content served by Amazon.com and Web sites using Checkout by Amazon payment service), and storage of items in your Shopping Cart between visits.
(highlight is mine)

This is the other side of websites with clauses like “Third party advertisers may also place or read cookies on your browser.” which is considered bad in TOS;DR. 

--
www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/Unhosted/ToS-DR

subject: [Bad] Amazon uses cookies to identify users in third party websites
text:
http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=footer_privacy?ie=UTF8&nodeId=468496 

> Cookies are unique identifiers that we transfer to your device to enable 
> our systems to recognize your device and to provide features such as 
> 1-Click purchasing, Recommended for You, *personalized advertisements on 
> other Web sites* (e.g., Amazon Associates with content served by 
> Amazon.com and Web sites using Checkout by Amazon payment service), and 
> storage of items in your Shopping Cart between visits.

(highlight is mine)

This is the other side of websites with clauses like “Third party 
advertisers may also place or read cookies on your browser.” which is 
considered bad in TOS;DR. 

-- 
www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/Unhosted/ToS-DR
